alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: The National Weather Service in Caribou Maine has issued a * Small Stream Flood Advisory for... Southeastern Aroostook County in northern Maine... Central Penobscot County in east central Maine... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding in the advisory area. Culverts may also fill with water and cause minor flooding. Radar estimates that one to two inches of rain has fallen in the area. The heavy rain is currently moving out of the area. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sherman, Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Stacyville, Glenwood, Grindstone, Silver Ridge, Benedicta and Monarda.
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
